column1: TA6.29;Terrestrial ecosystems. Member States shall put in place [...] measures [...] to jointly cover
column3: throughout the areas and ecosystems [...] defined in Art. 2
column5: at least 20% of land areas in need of restoration and
column7: all ecosystems in need of restoration.;TA1.3;+;The implementation of TA6.29 is likely to have a positive impact on TA1.3
column8: as restoring terrestrial ecosystems can help reduce greenhouse gas emissions and contribute to the EU's overall climate ambition of reducing emissions by at least 55% by 2030. This is because restored ecosystems can act as carbon sinks
column10: and can also help reduce emissions from land use changes.

column2: coastal and freshwater ecosystems. Member States shall put in place the restoration measures [...] to improve to good condition areas of habitat types listed in Annex I which are not in good condition;TA1.9;+;The implementation of TA6.31 is likely to have a positive impact on TA1.9

column1: TA6.34;Natural connectivity of rivers and natural functions of the related floodplains. Member States shall make an inventory of artificial barriers and remove them to connectivity of surface waters;TA2.4;+;The implementation of TA6.34 is likely to have a positive impact on TA2.4

column1: TA1.3;Reduce by at least 55% net GHG emissions compared to 1990 levels
column2: by 2030.;TA6.29;-;The implementation of TA1.3 may have a negative impact on TA6.29

column1: TA1.9;EU ETS. The contribution of the sectors covered by the existing EU Emission trading System (EU ETS) with respect to the EU Climate ambition should be of -62% compared to 2005;TA6.31;-;The implementation of TA1.9 may have a negative impact on TA6.31
